c74object.name: cage.ezptrack
c74object.description: Connects neighbor notes in a bach.roll, depending on a time threshold and a pitch threshold for connections, as in a partial tracking algorithm.

objarg.name: pitchthresh
objarg.description: Initial value of the pitchthresh attribute.

objarg.name: timethresh
objarg.description: Initial value of the timethresh attribute.

method.name: bang
method.description: Build the output bach.roll from the most recently received input llll.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in the first inlet is expected to contain the gathered syntax of the whole bach.roll (e.g. retrieven via a dump or dump body message, or obtained via bach.sdif.peaks.toroll). An llll with the header and the list of voice flags is then output through the outlet (which must be connected to the output bach.roll) and then a sequence of gluechord message is output. This messages have the following effect: notes which starts whenever a similar note ends (within pitch and time thresholds defined by the timethresh and pitchthresh attributes) are connected to the previous one, which thus is made longer.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: pitchthresh
attribute.description: Maximum distance (in midicents) between two notes in order for them to be connected. Default is 25mc.

attribute.name: timethresh
attribute.description: Maximum distance (in milliseconds) between the tail of a note and the head of another, in order for them to be connected. Default is 5ms.

c74object.discussion: This algorithm does not account for glissandi.
